text: The travellers from the New World who had been in Britain many times before, were slightly stunned. Afterwards they said: "We thought we knew it all, but you Britishers run out of unturned stones." To the British Travel Association, doing their excellent darndest, I offer these sad complexities. IN the 1830's the Luddites took sledge-hammers to their looms and many a good trade unionist since then has, in the hope of improving the lot of his fellow workers, taken the theoretical Luddite hammer again.
